article:
A 'vice president' (British English - government: 'vice-president'; business:
'[[Director (business)|director]]') is an officer in government or business who
is below a president (managing director) in rank. The name comes from the Latin
[[List of Latin phrases (S-Z)#vice|vice]] meaning 'in place of'. [http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=vice-
"vice"], etymologyonlive.com In some countries, the vice president is
called the deputy president. A common colloquial term for the office is vee-pee,
deriving from a phonetic interpretation of the abbreviation VP.
headings: In clubs and other related associations
